Package com.example.paragonPioneerBackend.Util

Class ServiceUtil

java.lang.Object
com.example.paragonPioneerBackend.Util.ServiceUtil
public class ServiceUtil extends Object
Utility class for operations related to services. Provides methods for updating entity fields based on patch requests, as well as methods for retrieving entities from repositories based on entity IDs or slugs.

  • Method Details

    • patchHelper

      public static String patchHelper(String toUpdate, String next)
      This helper method is used to determine which String value should be used between two given String values. It checks if the 'next' value is null or empty. If either condition is true, it returns the 'toUpdate' value. Otherwise, it returns the 'next' value. This method is useful when you want to update a value but also want to preserve the original value under certain conditions.
      Parameters:
      toUpdate - The original String value that might be updated.
      next - The new String value that might replace the original value.
      Returns:
      The original String value if 'next' is null or empty, otherwise the new String value.

    • patchHelper

      public static boolean patchHelper(Boolean toUpdate, Boolean next)
      This helper method is used to determine which Boolean value should be used between two given Boolean values. It checks if the 'next' value is null. If it is true, it returns the 'toUpdate' value. Otherwise, it returns the 'next' value. This method is useful when you want to update a value but also want to preserve the original value under certain conditions.
      Parameters:
      toUpdate - The original Boolean value that might be updated.
      next - The new Boolean value that might replace the original value.
      Returns:
      The original Boolean value if 'next' is null, otherwise the new Boolean value.

    • patchHelper

      public static float patchHelper(Float toUpdate, Float next)
      This helper method is used to determine which float value should be used between two given float values. It checks if the 'next' value is null or if the 'toUpdate' value is 0. If either condition is true, it returns the 'toUpdate' value. Otherwise, it returns the 'next' value. This method is useful when you want to update a value but also want to preserve the original value under certain conditions.
      Parameters:
      toUpdate - The original float value that might be updated.
      next - The new float value that might replace the original value.
      Returns:
      The original float value if 'next' is null or 'toUpdate' is 0, otherwise the new float value.

    • patchHelper

      public static int patchHelper(Integer toUpdate, Integer next)
      This helper method is used to determine which Integer value should be used between two given Integer values. It checks if the 'next' value is null or if the 'toUpdate' value is 0. If either condition is true, it returns the 'toUpdate' value. Otherwise, it returns the 'next' value. This method is useful when you want to update a value but also want to preserve the original value under certain conditions.
      Parameters:
      toUpdate - The original Integer value that might be updated.
      next - The new Integer value that might replace the original value.
      Returns:
      The original Integer value if 'next' is null or 'toUpdate' is 0, otherwise the new Integer value.

    • patchHelper

      public static <Type extends BaseEntity> Type patchHelper(Type toUpdate, String entity, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Type,UUID> repository)
      This helper method is used to determine which BaseEntity value should be used between two given BaseEntity values. It checks if the 'nextID' value is null. If it is true, it returns the 'toUpdate' value. Otherwise, it attempts to find the BaseEntity in the repository using the 'nextID'. If the BaseEntity is not found, it throws an EntityNotFoundException. This method is useful when you want to update a value but also want to preserve the original value under certain conditions.
      Type Parameters:
      Type - The type of the BaseEntity.
      Parameters:
      toUpdate - The original BaseEntity value that might be updated.
      entity - The ID of the new BaseEntity that might replace the original value.
      repository - The JpaRepository where the BaseEntity is stored.
      Returns:
      The original BaseEntity value if 'nextID' is null, otherwise the new BaseEntity value.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if the BaseEntity with the 'nextID' is not found in the repository.

    • getHelper

      public static <Type extends Slugable> Type getHelper(String entity, SlugableReposetory<Type> repository)
      This helper method is used to retrieve a Slugable entity from the repository. It first tries to parse the provided entity string as a UUID. If successful, it attempts to find the entity in the repository by its UUID. If the entity string cannot be parsed as a UUID, it assumes the string is a slug and attempts to find the entity in the repository by its slug. If the entity is not found in the repository by either its UUID or slug, it throws an EntityNotFoundException.
      Type Parameters:
      Type - The type of the Slugable entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The string that represents the UUID or slug of the entity.
      repository - The SlugableReposetory where the Slugable entity is stored.
      Returns:
      The Slugable entity if found in the repository.
      Throws:
      CastException - if the Slugable entity is not found in the repository.

    • getHelper

      public static <Type extends BaseEntity> Set<Type> getHelper(String[] entity, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Type,UUID> repository)
      This method is used to retrieve a set of BaseEntity instances from the repository using an array of strings that represent the entities' IDs. It first checks if the entity array is null. If it is, it returns null. It then streams the entity array, filters out any blank strings, and maps each string to a UUID using the UuidUtil.getFromString method. For each UUID, it attempts to find the corresponding BaseEntity in the repository. If the BaseEntity is not found, it throws an EntityNotFoundException. It collects all the found BaseEntity instances into a set and returns it.
      Type Parameters:
      Type - The type of the BaseEntity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The array of strings that represent the IDs of the entities.
      repository - The JpaRepository where the BaseEntity instances are stored.
      Returns:
      A set of BaseEntity instances if found in the repository, or null if the entity array is null.
      Throws:
      EntityNotFoundException - if a BaseEntity with a given UUID is not found in the repository.

    • getHelperNoNull

      public static <Type extends Slugable> Type getHelperNoNull(String entity, SlugableReposetory<Type> repository)
      This method is used to retrieve a Slugable entity from the repository using a given string that represents the entity's ID or slug. It first checks if the entity string is null or empty. If either condition is true, it throws a CastException. It then tries to parse the entity string as a UUID. If successful, it attempts to find the entity in the repository by its UUID. If the entity string cannot be parsed as a UUID, it attempts to find the entity in the repository by its slug. If the entity is not found in the repository by either its UUID or slug, it throws the exception that was caught when trying to parse the entity string as a UUID.
      Type Parameters:
      Type - The type of the Slugable entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The string that represents the UUID or slug of the entity.
      repository - The SlugableReposetory where the Slugable entity is stored.
      Returns:
      The Slugable entity if found in the repository.
      Throws:
      CastException - if the entity string is null or empty, or if the entity is not found in the repository by either its UUID or slug.
      EntityNotFoundException - if the Slugable entity with the parsed UUID is not found in the repository.

    • ifErrorThenNull

      public static <T extends BaseEntity> T ifErrorThenNull(Function<String,T> function, String entityIdSlug)
      This method is used to apply a function to a given string representing an entity ID or slug. If the function throws an exception, the method catches it and returns null. This method is useful when you want to perform an operation that might throw an exception, but you want to handle the exception and return a default value instead.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the BaseEntity.
      Parameters:
      function - The function to be applied to the entityIdSlug.
      entityIdSlug - The string that represents the ID or slug of the entity.
      Returns:
      The result of applying the function to the entityIdSlug, or null if the function throws an exception.

    • ifErrorThenNull

      public static <T extends BaseEntity> Set<T> ifErrorThenNull(Function<String[],Set<T>> function, String[] entityIdSlug)
      This method is used to apply a function to a given array of strings representing entity IDs or slugs. It attempts to apply the function to the entityIdSlug array. If the function throws an exception, the method catches it and returns null. This method is useful when you want to perform an operation that might throw an exception, but you want to handle the exception and return a default value instead.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the BaseEntity.
      Parameters:
      function - The function to be applied to the entityIdSlug array.
      entityIdSlug - The array of strings that represent the IDs or slugs of the entities.
      Returns:
      The result of applying the function to the entityIdSlug array, or null if the function throws an exception.
